self.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started)
fields.implementationNotes: The date the PK samples were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, or observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether all of the PK samples in this group were collected.
fields.definition: An indication of whether PK samples were collected
fields.implementationNotes: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type, or all samples taken for some purpose, and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form. Each sample collected could result in 1 or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.
fields.label: PK Sampling Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF="N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF="Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: PCPERF

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.
fields.definition: An explanation for why the data are not available
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: PK Sampling Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PCREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).
fields.definition: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: PK Sample Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format..
fields.name: PCDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record start time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)
fields.implementationNotes: A complete time is expected. In interval collection, start can be added as needed to the question text, prompt and CRF directions. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.
fields.label: PK Sample Collection Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format..
fields.name: PCTIM
fields.questionText: What was the start time of the PK sample collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date when PK sample collection stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY)
fields.definition: The end date of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)
fields.implementationNotes: The end date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: PK Sample Collection End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the end date of the specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record end time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The end time of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)
fields.implementationNotes: A complete end time is expected. The SDTMIG variable PCENDTC variable contains the end date/time, when a specimen is collected over time. If there is no end date/time, the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC should be Null.
fields.label: PK Sample Collection End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: PCENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the specimen collection end time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCTPT

self.title: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time-point labels for the PK sample collection, if not pre-printed on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time points when measurements should be taken, as defined in the protocol
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then terms such as "Planned Time Point" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time-point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.
fields.name: PCTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time
fields.implementationNotes: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect, and it is important to know whether the dose was taken after the subject had fasted.
fields.label: PK Sampling Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PCFAST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCCOND

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether protocol-defined testing conditions were met.
fields.definition: Indication of whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low fat diet)
fields.implementationNotes: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). Examples: calorie fast, fluid fast, high-fat meal, low-fat meal, exercise. This may not be relevant for all tests.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Condition Met
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM ="PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: PCCOND
fields.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier)
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: PK Sampling Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: PCREFID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCSPEC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: The type of specimen used for a PK sample
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: PK Sampling Specimen Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PCSPEC

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCTEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, pH). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: PK Sampling Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: PCTEST

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: PK Sampling Result in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the PK sampling test result.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: PK Sampling Result in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PCORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the test?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

parentScenario.title: PK Sample Collection over a Time Interval

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field PK Sample Collection Time Interval.PCORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the PK sampling test result.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: PK Sampling Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: PCORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the result?
